questions.text: What is the name of Jerry's girlfriend?
questions.explanation:
Nina.

	Nina is an aspiring artist and Jerry frequently visits her loft.  He invites George to go to the loft with him.

questions.text: What sporting event do Elaine, George and Kramer go to?
questions.explanation:
A baseball game.

	Nina gives the group tickets to see the Yankees game in the owner's box above the dugout.  Jerry is unable to attend the match.

questions.text: Where was Elaine supposed to be during the event?
questions.explanation:
bris.

	Elaine decided not to go to her boss' son's bris so that she could see the game.  In a future episode, Elaine will need to find a mohel to perform a bris.

questions.text: What will Elaine not take off at the event?
questions.explanation:
hat.

	Elaine wears a Baltimore Orioles cap to the game, and Nina's father asks if she'll take it off because she's in the owner's box.  She decides to leave rather than take it off.

questions.text: What is Elaine's excuse for being away from her boss' event?
questions.explanation:
She was visiting her father.

	She pretended that her father was sick in a hospital in Maryland, but when she was at the game, someone put her picture in a newspaper.

questions.text: How much does George have to pay for the painting?
questions.explanation:
Five hundred dollars.

	George is angry about the price because the picture is just a bunch of squiggly lines.

questions.text: What movie did Jerry's girlfriend copy the lines from to put into her letter?
questions.explanation:
Chapter Two.

	"Chapter Two" is on Jerry's TV and when George flips to the channel it's on, Jerry immediately realizes that Nina copied the exact dialogue in her letter.

questions.text: Who invites Elaine to go to a baseball game at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Lippman

	Mr. Lippman thinks it would be funny if Elaine wore her Baltimore cap in the owner's box, but he doesn't know that she was the one who did it last time.

questions.text: Does Jerry break up with his girlfriend?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	He ends up breaking up with her because she copied her letter from the movie.  George still has to pay for the painting he bought, but he tries selling it to Jerry for ten bucks.

Yes.

	An older couple buys the portrait from Nina because they think he's disgusting and artistic.  They buy it for five thousand dollars.
